questions.question: In a two-degree-of-freedom system, the degrees of freedom refer to:

answers.a: The number of wheels on the vehicle
answers.b: The number of springs in the suspension
answers.c: The number of independent motion modes
answers.d: The number of gears in the transmission

questions.question: The purpose of anti-roll bars in a two-degree-of-freedom system is to:

answers.b: Limit lateral body roll during cornering

explanations.a: The right answer is (b). The purpose of anti-roll bars (also known as sway bars or stabilizer bars) in a two-degree-of-freedom system is to limit lateral body roll during cornering. These bars connect the left and right sides of the suspension, resisting the tendency of the vehicle to lean excessively when turning.
